flawed_nl_solution:
Start by finding how many fish were in the aquarium on the third day 6 * 2 * 2 = <<6*2*2=42>>42.
On day three, Jason took out one-third of the fish 42 / 3 = <<42/3=14>>14.
So at the end of day three, he has 42 - 14 = <<42-14=28>>28 fish.
On day five he has 28 * 2 * 2 = 112 fish, but he takes out one-fourth.
So he took out 112 / 4 = <<112/4=28>>28 fishes.
So at the end of day five, he has 112 - 28 = <<112-28=84>>84 fish.
On day seven he has 84 * 2 * 2 = <<84*2*2=336>>336 fish.
He adds in 15 more, so he has 336 + 15 = <<336+15=351>>351 fish in total.
#### 351

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 24, not 42. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
